story.text: NEW YORK Jan 3 The euro rose to an eight-year high against the Swiss franc on Wednesday, as investors continued a broad trend of selling low yielding currencies. The euro climbed to a high of 1.6175 Swiss francs, according to electronic trading platform EBS. The dollar rose around 1.3 percent against the Swiss currency, to 1.2295 francs CHF= -- on pace for the largest single-day gain since July 2005.
story.title: euro rises to 8 - year high vs swiss franc
